instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7122: What is R7122? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A does not turn on
threads.message:
Hello friends, I have a macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that does not turn on.
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_INRUSH</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>CHGR_SGATE</SIGNAL> = 0v

The voltage goes up to <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> = 20v and <SIGNAL>CHGR_AGATE_DIV</SIGNAL> = 19.20v
I have changed the isl625 charging circuit 3 times thinking that the one they sent me was bad.

I have 6 months with that damaged macbook, it is mine, when I started to repair it, the macbook turned on when I pressed the charging ic.

Sorry for so much trouble, I hope you can help me fix it

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A does not turn on
threads.message:
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage?
Check diode mode to ground at L7095 and F7140.

Post <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> basic voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.
Use surrounding components as test points; do not check directly on chip pins (when possible).

Exact resistance (ohm scale) between pins 17/18 and 27/28?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A does not turn on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A does not turn on
threads.message:
"3 = 0v"
Missing ACIN for <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.
Replace <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR>; be sure has good traces.
Also check <RESISTOR>R7111</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A does not turn on
threads.message:
amigo, regreso este equipo se calienta al cargar, el cargador llega hasta 50grados centigrados, y en consumo llega hasta 4.5A, aparte cuando se utiliza con la bateria, se descarga muy rapido. te pongo los links de los videos de la camara termica.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A does not turn on
threads.message:
Si la bateria es vieja, o china, no puedes esperar que aguante mucho.
Ademas, cuando se usa la grafica dedicada, el consumo sube.
Al menos revisa cuantos ciclos lleva la bateria.

"el cargador llega hasta 50grados centigrados"
No me parece una temperatura muy elevada.
Es normal que caliente si hay gran consumo; 85W Apple original?
Desactivar GPU disminuye el consumo y alarga la vida de la bateria.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A does not turn on
threads.message: pero es normal que la computadora se alente demaciado cuando calienta el cargador ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A does not turn on
threads.message:
Run corresponding ASD, or start in Diagnostic mode and check for errors.
HWMonitor can also help you.
